contextId.information: The noun "redemption" can be translated with the verb "redeem." AT: "to redeem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The noun "redemption" can be translated with the verb "redeem." AT: "to redeem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The word "work" is an abstract noun that can be expressed with the verb "serving." AT: "used when serving Yahweh in the holy place" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: for the work in the holy place

contextId.information: Here the word "service" is an abstract noun that can be expressed by a verb.  Here the word "This" refers to what Yahweh just said. AT: "This is how the clans of the descendants of the Gershonites will serve in the tent of meeting" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: This is the service of the clans of the descendants of the Gershonites for the tent of meeting

contextId.information: The word "direction" is an abstract noun that is expressed by a verb. AT: "as Ithamar son of Aaron the priest directs them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest

contextId.information: The word "separation" is an abstract noun that can be expressed as a verb. Here "separation" is an idiom that means "dedication." AT: "the days that he has separated himself to Yahweh" or "the days that he has dedicated himself to  Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: the days of his separation to Yahweh

contextId.information: The abstract noun "counting" can be stated as a verb. AT: "had helped Aaron and Moses to count the men" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: had overseen the counting of the men

contextId.information: The word "service," an abstract noun, can be expressed as a verb. AT: "to serve" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The word "command" can be expressed as a verb. AT: "When Yahweh commanded" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
This refers to whoever or whatever might protect them. AT: "Anyone that might protect them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
Here "complaints" is an abstract noun that can be expressed as a verb. AT: "make the people of Israel stop complaining against you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: cause the complaints from the people of Israel to stop, which they are speaking against you

contextId.information: The abstract noun "divination" can be stated as an action. AT: "money to pay Balaam to curse Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "destruction" can be stated as an action. AT: "God will destroy them also" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: they, too, will end in destruction

contextId.information: The word "atonement" may be expressed as a verb. AT: "to atone" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The word "atonement" can be expressed with the verb "atone." AT: "to atone" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The word "atonement" can be expressed with the verb "atone." AT: "to atone" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The word "atonement" can be expressed with the verb "atone." AT: "that atones for you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The word "obligations" can be expressed with the verb "obligate." AT: "the things she has obligated herself to" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
